events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their car on April 9th, resulting in significant front-end damage. Claim was officially filed this morning.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under the Auto Accident cluster due to keywords such as vehicle collision and car accident present in the report.
The claim was assigned to agent Michael Thompson, who specializes in vehicle claims and has a high satisfaction rating.
The customer was contacted to acknowledge receipt of the claim and informed about the next steps in the assessment process.
The agent requested a police report, photos of the damaged car, and a copy of the driver's insurance card to proceed with claim evaluation.
The customer submitted all requested documents including the police report, multiple photos showing the damage, and proof of insurance.
Investigation into the details of the accident has begun; agent reviewing submitted evidence and contacting witnesses for further verification.
Investigation concluded successfully confirming the liability of the other driver and assessing damage estimates for the claim settlement.
A settlement offer of $5,200 was proposed to cover repair costs and related expenses based on the investigation and damage assessment.
The customer expressed gratitude for the timely and fair handling of the claim process and agreed to the settlement proposed.
Final approval was granted by the claims manager after ensuring all documentation and customer agreements were in place.
The payment for the agreed settlement amount was processed and issued to the customerâ€™s designated bank account.
The claim has been officially closed after payment issuance and confirmation of receipt by the customer.
All claim records and documents related to this auto accident were archived as per company policy for future reference.
